My weekend read was @sabinaleonelli 's
"Philosophy of Open Science" (http://philsci-archive.pitt.edu/21986/). Strongly recommended to anyone who cares about #OpenScience.

Most important: the distinction between "object-oriented OpenScience" (roughly the #FAIR principles) and "process-oriented OpenScience", which is about wider participation in scientific research. It's the latter we need for making science relevant for society.

Good morning. It still looks like rain, it's also time to get my 💡 thinking about comment control, showing all replies, account migration, reducing server load, federating likes, and what not out of my brain. It's a true incompatible to the current FediVerse ActivityPub extension.

Before the list, lots of good stuff happening for Web-based protocol handlers @ fediverse-ideas. I'll also be adding this to fediverse-ideas.

💡A Conversation is a new type of ActivityPub object, that is Hosted by a single Actor.

💡Actors Contribute to the Conversation by sending the the corresponding content to the Host.

💡The Host's task is to distribute and store the Conversation. Host may aggregate stuff before distributing, e.g. for emoji reactions.

💡Host has "moderation privilege". Contributors are allowed to invite actors to contribute.

💡Contributors may "walk away" and start the conversation elsewhere.

💡🛠️ Contributions are signed. Contributions can be updated including the attributedTo field with proper signatures (allows for portable accounts).

💡🛠️ Contributions' ids are assigned by the user as a globally unique fragment to the conversation.

title: Get help with integrated weed management - The Global Plant Council

last_post.content:
Get help with integrated weed management

The EU has set a target to reduce pesticide use by 50% by 2030. Therefore, a strong focus on integrated weed management must be maintained in the coming years. When it comes to weeds, the focus has mainly been on improving the efficacy of pesticides, replacing or complementing them with mechanical treatments in the field.

Now a new free digital tool can help farmers plan weed control with reduced pesticide use.

via IWMPRAISE

https://globalplantcouncil.org/get-help-with-integrated-weed-management/

Yes. SpaceX has done bad things and deserves to be criticized for them. But (and I think this is analogous to a lot of issues) the problem here isn’t that SpaceX isn’t NASA; it’s that NASA doesn’t have the political room to experiment and inevitably sometimes fail that SpaceX does. This is too complex an issue to fit all the layers and nuance into one honk, but “SpaceX is bad because their rockets explode” is not a good analysis. https://chaos.social/@russss/110249195107310284

title: Towards a Bibliography for AI Systems | Ryan C. Cordell

last_post.content:
For those interested, I’ve posted the text of my talk "Toward a Bibliography for AI Systems" on my website: https://ryancordell.org/research/aibibliography/

I titled the talk "*Toward* a Bibliography" because this is very preliminary research, but I do expect to keep working in this direction. I think I best express the deep impetus for the work toward the end of the talk: "Bringing together bibliographical and computational approaches allows us to perceive AI systems not as unknowable oracles but instead bound, describable, and comparable cultural artifacts. "

I am presenting this talk even *as I post this* as part of the Society of Fellows in Critical Bibliography’s symposium today on "Preserving and Analyzing Digital Texts" https://rarebookschool.org/all-programs/events/preserving-and-analyzing-digital-texts/

For those interested, I’ve posted the text of my talk "Toward a Bibliography for AI Systems" on my website: https://ryancordell.org/research/aibibliography/

title: Boomers, you’ve done OK – but don’t expect undying affection from us millennials

last_post.content: Boomers, you’ve done OK – but don’t expect undying affection from us millennials https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2023/apr/23/boomers-done-ok-but-dont-expect-undying-affection-from-us-millennials?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other I hate articles like this, the sweeping generalisations, the failure to recognise that older women are numbering highly amongst the homeless, that ageism & health issues make it hard for older people to find & hold suitable work, that some people are having to work well beyond retirement age because they can’t afford to retire. Generational divides distract us from the real issues of insufficiently regulated & inequitably taxed capitalism. #Ageism #TaxReform

Judith Love Cohen was the engineer who made Apollo's Abort Guidance System, which was crucial to saving the ill-fated Apollo 13. She finished it while in labor, then (the same day) delivered her younger son -- the actor Jack Black.

This is one of those utterly remarkable #space stories that I stumble over once in a while and it blows my mind afresh every single time.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judith_Love_Cohen

title: AudioPen | Transform unstructured voice notes into clearly summarized text.

last_post.content:
Anyone have experience with https://audiopen.ai/ ?

As someone that likes to go on 'thinking walks', I frequently take short audio notes with Google Keep. It transcribes them into text but what I get is a bit jumbled and messy.

AudioPen let's me *ramble* into the mic for several minutes, pausing and rephrasing yet it still manages to produce a clean summary. This feels like a proper use case for **#chatgpt** ! I've been very impressed so far. Looking for any others comments on the tech.
I Played Kazoo Under Water https://youtu.be/eB4sYLKhEdc via @YouTube

title: Iris – The nostr client for better social networks

last_post.content:
Early employee Twitter @rabble has a different opinion on Nostr.

He believes it’s only a matter of time before relays will be regulated.

It’s important to understand that @rabble is making his own Nostr client—one which is very good, and makes the best case for Nostr so far.

But more importantly, he knows full well that every social network, regardless of protocol, requires moderation—even if users don’t believe in it.

https://iris.to/note18rmhan2t0g6h9h7f5vd6v4r9hwvlavw9werljdhcpthrm6g6q3zqg2zz2v

Do you work with #voice or #speech #data? You might contribute data, write data specifications for collection, perform filtering or pre-processing, train #ASR or #TTS models, or design or perform evaluations on #ML speech models.

If so, I’d love your help to understand current #dataset #documentation practices, and what we can do to make them better as part of my #PhD #research

The #survey takes 10-20 minutes to complete, and you can opt in to win one of 3 gift cards valued at $AUD 50 each.

Research Protocol 2021/427 approved by #ANU Human Research Ethics Committee

https://anu.au1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_cSFODa5osYtm96e

title: An Open Letter to Vitalik Buterin - Wynne - Medium

last_post.content:
Y'all people told me that Yudkowsky gave a m'fuckin TED talk. How is this even real life? Someone just decides to call themselves "a decision theorist" with ZERO experience, expertise or anything & start a cult where people worship his self proclaimed "high IQ", then advocates for terrorism to stop the impending #AGI apocalypse & New York Times, TIME, TED are just like whoaaaa. Genius. Tell us more. Not to mention all the awful stuff about assault written in this letter.
https://fredwynne.medium.com/an-open-letter-to-vitalik-buterin-ce4681a7dbe

title: Why Silicon Valley is bringing eugenics back

last_post.content:
Silicon Valley’s elite made their billions through luck, not genius. But as the public turns on them, they want to protect their privilege, so they’re trying to convince us they’re inherently superior.

For Disconnect, I explain how billionaires like Elon Musk are bringing eugenics back by promoting effective altruism, longtermism, and pronatalism. The goal is to cement their position at the top, and we need to stop them.

https://www.disconnect.blog/p/why-silicon-valley-is-bringing-eugenics

#tech #elonmusk #inequality

We are proud to announce the conference "Linguistic Intersections of #Language and #Gender"! It will take place 20-21 July @ Düsseldorf, Germany + online!

We welcome linguistic research on gender-related topics from pretty much all areas of #linguistics!

The CfP is open - the abstract submission deadline is 10 May!

We are looking forward to many interesting and insightful contributions!

http://lilg.div-ling.org

#LILG

The Awesome PyLadies' Blogs Repository is growing 🤩

I spent some evenings during the past weeks finding and reaching out to people (also for the Awesome R-Ladies' Blogs repository). It's so cool to see all the different blogs and feeds! 😍

If you have a blog yourself, feel free to submit it here:

:python: #pyladies: https://bit.ly/py-list

💜 #rladies: https://bit.ly/list-r

last_post.content: @ricard Thank you for your purge-media.sh script and write-up (https://ricard.dev/improving-mastodons-disk-usage/)! Coming in really handy.

https://gist.github.com/mdsumner/d2c5e3e517bd7802b5ef96497b377c0a

title: Inducing anxiety in large language models increases exploration and bias

last_post.content:
Oh my...

Inducing anxiety in large language models increases exploration and bias

"...subject [GPT3.5] to tasks commonly studied in psychiatry. Our results show that GPT-3.5 responds robustly to a common anxiety questionnaire, producing higher anxiety scores than human subjects. Moreover, GPT-3.5's responses can be predictably changed by using emotion-inducing prompts."

https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.11111

@tchambers @blake like user centric accounts, you can bring your own algorithm.

Jay has some great posts on her views and hopes https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/3-30-2023-algorithmic-choice

As you can see, lots of it will be up to 3rd party devs, just like Fediview.

Hello Fediverse! 👋

#Wikipedia :wikipedia: is a multilingual free online encyclopedia written and maintained by a community of volunteers, known as Wikipedians, through open collaboration and using a wiki-based editing system called MediaWiki. -- or so says our Wikipedia article (https://w.wiki/W).

Follow for cool facts, behind-the-scenes details on editing processes and tips on getting started contributing!

title: Navigator: registerProtocolHandler() method - Web APIs | MDN

last_post.content:
@tchambers Agreed.

A very long time. Safari will grow up to be a real browser some day; web developers should never let them hold us back, so it should be summarily ignored. And as I mentioned, mobile would be up to apps.

See:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/registerProtocolHandler#browser_compatibility
and
https://caniuse.com/registerprotocolhandler
